runs.comm: tossed up on middle, Shahzad frees his arms and slaps it wide of the cover fielder, intent straightaway
floats it just around off, pushed to cover point
looks to biff that over the infield, gets a thick inside-edge to deep midwicket. His front foot is way outside the popping crease, interesting action
looks to work it wide of midwicket, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad, there was a stifled appeal from the bowler
flatter one on middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg
takes it on the full and flicks it towards wide long-on, the fielder was late to get off the blocks there
back of length delivery on off, pushed to short cover
powerful wrists. Too full and straying down leg, and the flick sails way over deep midwicket. Can't bowl there
plants his front foot and crunches that on the up past extra cover. Not much bounce or swing, easy pickings. Not all that bad a delivery though
a misfield at midwicket gives them a single, he checked his shot at the last moment, landed in front of the fielder there
touch fuller on off, angled towards point, they scamper through for a quick single. Shahzad looked up and within a second, Noor Ali was off the blocks
shows the full face of the bat and drives it down to mid-on, hit it well so the fielder was under pressure
hits the deck hard from wide of the crease, lands it on off, punched to cover
width on offer, scoring opportunity missed. He slashed at that one, played too early, beaten
this time, he crunches the short ball straight to point
cleverly done. Uses the pace of the bowler and angles it past the vacant slip cordon. The trick was to play it late, which he did. Third man was too square

this time, the third man, who was square, has come into the picture. It was short and wide, should have been clattered over point. But Noor Ali slashed too hard, only managed a thick edge which carried to Davey, who caught it well. He had to run in a couple of paces from the ropes, and he did it without a fuss. That should boost Scotland, for it was turning out to be an aggressive start from Afghanistan
third man into the picture again as Shahzad dabs it late
full and straight on middle, he hops back and taps it to the off side
bat face turns as he looks to play it through point, a slight misfield gives them a single
steps out, but it ends up being too full for him to hit through the line, squeezed back to the bowler
steps out and muscles it over deep midwicket. Didn't quite get to the pitch but picked the length early and generated enough power with the swing as the ball sailed over
beaten by the late away movement, goes to the keeper on the bounce
slower one on off, drops it with soft hands towards cover point and gets across quickly for a run to keep strike
gets a thick inside edge, not too far from the off stump, keeper does well to change tracks and stop that
gets half forward and taps it to mid-off
full and just around off, he looks to play a full blooded drive, but checks his shot again, rolls to the cover fielder
rolls his wrists and whips it towards deep square leg
slower one on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for a quick single, Shahzad was off the blocks the moment he hit it
accurate stuff again, full on middle, driven back to the bowler who stops it well on his followthrough
gentle tap to mid-on for a quick single, they're milking it easily
driven through the line to mid-off, the fielder there was a little too deep
on the shorter side, shapes to pull but doesn't get hold of it, rolls off the toe end to deep midwicket
full toss, swung away to the man at midwicket, Mommsen dived full length to his left to stop that, have to say he has saved three runs
takes it on the full and hits it straight to midwicket again, was three paces down the pitch when he made contact, that allowed him to get across for the single
slower one, looks to make room but gets yorked, squeezed back to the bowler
sharp turn and drift this time, he shapes to cut but the ball spins away late to beat the outside edge
reverse swept past short third man. Just wide of where the point fielder would have been. Excellent improvisation
shapes to cut again, this one was too full, it pitched and skid on
takes it on the full and thumps it back to the bowler who stops it well, fails to take toll of another full toss
full toss on middle, again, hit down to long-off, tried to drill it over the ropes, didn't get hold of it
short and sliding back into middle and leg, punched to long on
too full and on off, flicked to deep midwicket
tucked towards wide long-on, once again the fielder was caught napping. Excellent running from Shahzad
beaten as he looks to use the pace and run it down. It was too full for him to try that shot
whipped to deep square leg, this one was angling in at length from wide of the crease

tapped wide of cover for a quick single, a direct hit from the fielder there as the ball deflects into the off side. Third umpire called for. Shahzad just managed to get in, lazy effort you have to say
he's clubbed that into the second tier at deep midwicket. He lined himself up, almost as if he was waiting for the full one, and once it arrived, he couldn't stop himself from biffing that
pushed through quicker, lands it on off from round the stumps, driven to sweeper cover
full toss on middle, pushed back to the bowler. Could have swung it wherever he pleased
steps out and lofts it cleanly over long-off. Took good strides as he skipped down, got underneath it and made proper connection
straight, flat and long. He's on fire, isn't he? Steps out and hits it straight as a dye. Held his pose like he would for a helicopter shot. Dhoni style
sensibly done, turns it with soft hands and gets it wide of midwicket
driven with the angle to cover for a quick single
yorker-length delivery on middle, jams his bat down in time to squeeze it past the bowler to long-on
short outside off, slices it but straight to point
into the blockhole, he walks across to dig it out towards deep midwicket
length ball on off, bunted to point

looks to scoop it over short fine, the bowler does well to fire it full, landed it outside the wide line, but umpire Erasmus indicates to the batsman that his initial movement outside off made it a legal delivery
drilled over the bowler's head, splits it between long-off and long-on. Didn't get hold of it fully, it looked like, but still had enough power
slaps it awkwardly towards long-off
slower one on middle and leg, he wrists it into the gap at deep backward square leg
whipped to short fine leg, good sliding stop there

wow, the deft touch to go with his brutal power. This was banged in short, he walked across the stumps, used the pace and then scooped it wide of the wicketkeeper. He was looking away as he made contact
mistimes an attempted slog back to the bowler
fetches the pull from outside off to deep midwicket
excellent improvisation, makes room and then delicate dabs it past the diving short third man fielder. 10th T20I fifty for Shahzad. Arms wide open as he soaks in the applause of his teammates
pulled, but straight to the man at cow corner

lines himself to go over long-off, but ends up slicing it towards point, where the fielder misjudged it. The ball was swirling around for a long time, Berrington was put off by the fielder running in, grassed it in the end
looks to play the helicopter shot to long-off, ball flies off the slice of the bat, one bounce to third man
too short, he gets across and whips it to deep midwicket
yorks himself as he looks to play that full delivery outside off over midwicket
nearly lobs it to cover, who was a little too deep
superbly done, it was fired full around off, Shahzad plays a reverse dab past short third man
flat hit to long on, nearly yorked himself again
steps out and lofts it one bounce to long-on
looped it up nicely, Shahzad swung across the line and split the gap between deep midwicket and long-on

the party is over, but has he made an impact or what? This one was tossed up again, he backed himself to loft it over the bowler's head but didn't generate the kind of power as he would have liked, got it a little too high on the bat as the long on fielder ran across to his left to take that without too much hassle.
looks to slog across the line, gets a thin outside edge off the back of the bat, rolls wide of the keeper as they steal a run
slides one across the batsman, he mistimes a cut to the cover fielder
punched to long-off
worked with the turn to midwicket
pushed back to the bowler
swept powerfully into the gap between short fine leg and square leg. Too full and down leg, he'll pick those away for breakfast, lunch and dinner
steps out and works the low full toss on middle towards long on
punched across the line to long on again
full toss on middle, hit again to long on
loopy delivery on off, doesn't quite get to the pitch, hit towards long off
appeal for lbw as he looks to paddle it past short fine leg, was hit on middle. Batsman was outside the line when it struck him though
worked with the angle to long-on
well disguised slower one outside off, waited for it to arrive and then pulled it towards deep midwicket
sprays it well down leg
this one is full and way outside off, easy call for the umpire
looks to scoop the full delivery outside off over short fine, toe ends it towards point instead
squeezed towards point, once again nice and full outside off
backs away and hits it down to sweeper cover, the line is working, he's delivering the yorkers well
doesn't quite get the distance, the lofted hit falls in no man's land at wide long-off

outstanding catch! Machan was running in from the ropes at wide long-on, Gulbadin looked to lift it with the angle over, but didn't generate enough power. The fielder had to watch out for his momentum as it could have easily taken him forward, but he stopped at the right moment, then dived forward to complete the catch. The best thing about the catch was he was aware of his elbows hitting the ground and adjusted well to ensure the ball didn't bobble out
pulled towards deep midwicket
floats it full and just inside the wide line, he backs away to carve it but realised it was just out of his reach
low full toss outside off, lofted over cover, three fielders converge but none can prevent the second
looks to scoop it but ends up ramping the ball onto his body, hit him on the forearm
swing and a miss. Looked towards the sky but the bat was directed to long-on
once again flirts with the wide line, can't get away this time as the umpire feels the need to exercise, to be fair, it was just outside the line
full toss on off, drilled to long off

hit straight down the ground, so hard that it smashes into the stumps at the bowler's end and deflects towards the bowler, who quickly changes track on his followthrough to run towards the stumps and uproot it. Nabi was halfway down the pitch when he turned back, there was no way he would have made it back. Excellent match awareness from Evans, Nabi didn't expect it to go back onto the stumps
high full toss outside off, he looks to go inside out, ends up slicing it towards deep point
scooped towards short fine off the toe end
width on offer, hit hard but straight to point
flat hit, lands short of Macleod at long-on, he was readying to go for the catch but stopped for a brief while, that proved to be the difference between a wicket and a run

there's the boundary they have been searching for. Sets himself for a pull, sees the ball short outside off and swings across the line, turns out to be a rocket hit past the bowler's outstretched hands, bisects long-on and long-off with point precision
hit into the gap at deep cover, a misfield in the deep allowed the second
failed scoop again, rolls towards short fine, played it too early
hit towards square leg
too full and just outside off, he swings but fails to get underneath the ball, rolls to sweeper cover
french cut this time, not much the bowler can do. Excellent yorker, the ball hits the inside edge and deflects behind the keeper, not far away from the off stump
another scoop, another top edge, another mishit but it's a boundary nevertheless. This one was intended over short fine, but went over the keeper's head
gets a thick inside edge towards wide long-on

presence of mind from the bowler as he fires it full and down leg even as the batsman walks across to scoop, the non-striker had completed an entire run, only to see the Stanikzai stay put. Keeper hurls a throw to the bowler, who takes the bails off

drilled straight down the ground,  but it came off the bottom part of the bat, enough power in it as it plonks in between the two fielders in the deep, back for the second as the captain brings up his fifty. Muted celebration
swings and misses, but it was too full and way outside off

paddled over the keeper's head again. This one was dead straight and headed towards middle, for a moment it looked like he had walked across too far, but somehow managed to get some bat on it as he scooped it over
gets the direction wrong again, floats it far too wide for the batsman to reach
jams his bat down to squeeze that to cover
angling into middle and leg, hit firmly towards wide long-on
hit hard, the long-on fielder runs in quickly, picks it up cleanly and hurls a strong throw to the keeper, keeps it down to a single
